curam.util.exception

Class AppRuntimeException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • curam.util.exception.AppRuntimeException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DatabaseException, ReadmultiMaxException

    public class AppRuntimeException
extends java.lang.RuntimeException
    An unchecked exception that can be thrown by various Curam infrastructure facilities. Various facilities, especially those involving accesses to the application database may throw unchecked exceptions. It would be unwieldy for application code to have to explicitly handle all such exceptions. Therefore, AppRuntimeException and its various subclasses should be handled when it can be reasonably expected that such an exception could occur, e.g.: 
     try {
   myEntityObject.read(myKey);
 } catch (curam.util.exception.RecordNotFoundException e) {
   // handle it here
 }
    Usually, an AppException is caught, and an appropriate context-specific AppException is constructed and thrown in response. Using exception chaining, the AppRuntimeException can be tagged onto the end of the AppException if this is appropriate.

    A failure to handle an AppRuntimeException will result in it being caught by a "last-chance" exception handler and logged to a central log file. AppRuntimeException is implemented as a wrapper around an AppException, so it has the same message text and other functionality as AppException.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form
